translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Questions of the Simile-maker
The Earth Chapter🔽The Mountain-limbs

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘pabbatassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbānī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena pabbatassa pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti yam vadesi katamāni tāni pañca aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say five limbs of a mountain should be adopted, which are these five that should be adopted?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, pabbato acalo akampito asampavedhī;🔽evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sammānane vimānane sakkāre asakkāre garukāre
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja pabbataḥ acalaḥ a kampitaḥ a sampavedhī  evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena sammānane vimānane sakkāre asakkāre garukāre
translated: “As, sire, a mountain is unshaken, unmoved, unperturbed,

original: agarukāre yase ayase nindāya pasaṁsāya sukhe dukkhe iṭṭhāniṭṭhesu sabbattha rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbadhammesu
analyzed: agarukāre yase ayase nindāya pasasāya sukhe dukkhe iṭṭha aniṭṭhesu sabbattha rūpa sadda gandha rasa phoṭṭhabba dhammesu
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be unshaken, unmoved, unperturbed, in respect of honour and dishonour, in respect of fame and lack of fame, in respect of blame and praise, in respect of happiness and unhappiness, in respect of the desirable and the undesirable, in respect of all forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches and mental states that are worth being greedy for, worth being angry about, worth being deluded about,

original: rajanīyesu na rajjitabbaṁ, dussanīyesu na dussitabbaṁ, muyhanīyesu na muyhitabbaṁ,🔽na kampitabbaṁ na calitabbaṁ, pabbatena viya acalena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: rajanīyesu na rajjitabba dussanīyesu na dussitabba muyhanīyesu na muyhitabba  na kampitabba na calitabba pabbatena viya acalena bhavitabba
translated: he should not be shaken, he should not be moved, he should be like a mountain that does not shake.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, pabbatassa paṭhamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja pabbatassa paṭhamam aṅgam gahetabba
translated: This, sire, is the first limb of the mountain that should be adopted.
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One, the god over the gods:
“Just as a solid mass of rock🔽

analyzed: vātena na samīrati  evam nindā apasasāsu
translated: ‘Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the wind,
so the wise are not shaken by blame and praise.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, pabbato thaddho na kenaci saṁsaṭṭho;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja pabbataḥ thaddhaḥ na kenacid sa saṭṭhaḥ
translated: “And further, sire, a rock is solid and does not associate with anything;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena thaddhena asaṁsaṭṭhena bhavitabbaṁ, na kenaci saṁsaggo karaṇīyo.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena thaddhena a sasaṭṭhena bhavitabba na kenacid sa saggaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be solid and not associate with anyone.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, pabbatassa dutiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja pabbatassa dutiyam aṅgam gahetabba
translated: This, sire, is the second quality of the rock that must be adopted.
And this was said, sire, by the Blessed One, the god over the gods:
‘Not associating with householders🔽or with those gone into homelessness,
living in a place that is not crowded, and being content—
this one I call a brāhmaṇa.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, pabbate bījaṁ na virūhati;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja pabbate bījam na virūhati
translated: “And further, sire, no seed grows on a rock;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sakamānase kilesā na virūhāpetabbā.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena saka mānase kilesāḥ na virūhāpetabbā
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should not cause the defilements to grow in his own mind.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, pabbatassa tatiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja pabbatassa tatiyam aṅgam gahetabba
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of the rock that must be adopted.
And this was said, sire, by the Elder Subhūti:

analyzed: rāj ūpa sahitam  yadā uppajjate mama  sayava paccavekkhāmi
translated: ‘When my mind is associated with lust,🔽I look at it myself

original: ekaggo taṁ damemahaṁ.🔽Rajjase rajanīye ca,🔽dussanīye ca dussase;
analyzed: ekaggaḥ tam damemaha  rajjase rajanīye ca  dussanīye ca dussase
translated: And being one-pointed, I control it.🔽You are defiled by what should not defile,🔽And you are defiled by what is hard to defile.
You are deluded by what should not delude,
So get out of the forest!
This is the dwelling of the pure,🔽The stainless ones who are ascetics.
Do not defile the pure,
So get out of the forest!’

analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja pabbataḥ accuggataḥ
translated: “And further, sire, a mountain is lofty;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena ñāṇaccuggatena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena ñāṇa cuggatena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be lofty with knowledge.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, pabbatassa catutthaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja pabbatassa catuttham aṅgam gahetabba
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of the mountain that must be adopted.

analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā devātidevena  pamādam ap pamādena
translated: And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One, the god over the gods:🔽‘When the wise one with heedfulness
Drives out heedlessness,
Ascending the palace of wisdom,
The sorrowless one looks down on the sorrowful people,
As the one on the mountain top looks down on the one on the ground,
So the wise one looks down on the fool.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, pabbato anunnato anonato;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja pabbataḥ an unnataḥ an onataḥ
translated: “And further, sire, a mountain is not uneven, not low-lying;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena unnatāvanati na karaṇīyā.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena unnati avanati na karaṇīyā
translated: in the same way, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should not be lifted up or cast down.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, pabbatassa pañcamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja pabbatassa pañcamam aṅgam gahetabba
translated: This, sire, is the fifth quality of the mountain that must be adopted.

original: Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, upāsikāya cūḷasubhaddāya sakasamaṇe parikittayamānāya—
analyzed: mahā rāja upāsikāya cūḷasubhaddāya saka samaṇe parikittayamānāya
translated: And this was said, sire, by the laywoman Culla-Subhaddā, a Sakyan woman, when she was extolling the recluse:
‘The world is lifted up by gain,
and cast down by loss;
The recluse is the same in both,
such is the recluse to me.’“
The fifth chapter.
